biography.value:
“The three kobolds bear scars, surly expressions, and, in one case, a clockwork arm, all attesting to a hard life. Each kobold bristles with weapons: a mystical sword, a dripping harpoon, and a radiant crossbow. Their eyes scan the area, catching every detail.”

Monster hunters crave adventure and the thrill of the hunt. Each monster hunter specializes in slaying particular types of creatures. Some seek to rid the world of the danger the creatures present, while others seek the glory and renown slaying such creatures brings. Monster hunter kobolds don't have an official organization, but they recognize each other almost instantly, boisterously swapping stories over a rat kabob and ale. On occasion, monster hunters work together to take down a truly terrifying foe, sharing in the spoils and glory.

Life on the Sea.

Leviathan hunters enjoy wrestling and defeating great sea creatures—the bigger the better. These bulky kobolds spend most of their lives on the sea, always searching for that next big haul. The right target—a sea dragon, an @creature[aboleth], a @creature[sahuagin] outpost—can keep them and their companions living comfortably for many months. While these hunters frequently sign on with any ship looking for extra muscle, they typically end up captaining their own ship, giving them the freedom to chase down the monsters that others flee.

description.value: The leviathan hunter makes three Slam attacks, or it makes one Harpoon attack and two Slam attacks.

Melee Weapon Attack: [[/r 1d20+9]]{+9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 ([[/damage 2d6 + 5 type=bludgeoning]]) damage plus 9 ([[/damage 2d8 type=cold]]) damage or poison damage (the hunter's choice), and the target is &Reference[condition=grappled] (escape DC 17). The hunter can grapple only one target at a time.

Melee Weapon Attack: [[/r 1d20+9]]{+9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 ([[/damage 2d6 + 5 type=piercing]]) damage plus 9 ([[/damage 2d8 type=cold]]) damage or poison damage (the hunter's choice), and the harpoon sticks in the target. While the harpoon is stuck, the target takes 7 ([[/damage 2d6 type=piercing]]) damage at the start of each of its turns, the hunter can't make Harpoon attacks against other targets, and the target and hunter can't move further than 60 feet away from each other. A creature, including the target, can take its action to detach the harpoon by succeeding on a [[/save ability=strength dc=17]] check. Alternatively, the cord connecting the leviathan hunter to the harpoon can be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 25; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage), dislodging the harpoon into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the target and preventing the leviathan hunter from using Recall Harpoon.

Ranged Weapon Attack: [[/r 1d20+9]]{+9} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 12 ([[/damage 2d6 + 5 type=piercing]]) damage plus 9 ([[/damage 2d8 type=cold]]) damage or poison damage (the hunter's choice), and the harpoon sticks in the target. While the harpoon is stuck, the target takes 7 ([[/damage 2d6 type=piercing]]) damage at the start of each of its turns, the hunter can't make Harpoon attacks against other targets, and the target and hunter can't move further than 60 feet away from each other. A creature, including the target, can take its action to detach the harpoon by succeeding on a [[/save ability=strength dc=17]] check. Alternatively, the cord connecting the leviathan hunter to the harpoon can be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 25; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage), dislodging the harpoon into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the target and preventing the leviathan hunter from using Recall Harpoon.

One creature &Reference[condition=grappled] by the hunter must make a [[/save ability=strength dc=17]] saving throw, taking 33 ([[/damage 8d6 + 5 type=bludgeoning]]) damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The leviathan hunter can grapple creatures that are two sizes larger than itself and can move at its full speed when dragging a creature it has &Reference[condition=grappled]. If the hunter grapples a Medium or smaller creature, the target has disadvantage on its escape attempts. In addition, the hunter has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape a grapple or end the &Reference[condition=restrained] condition.
While the leviathan hunter is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Constitution modifier.
The hunter can hold its breath for 30 minutes.
The leviathan hunter has advantage on Wisdom (&Reference[skill=Perception]) and Wisdom (&Reference[skill=Survival]) checks to find and track Large or larger creatures with a swimming speed.

The leviathan hunter's weapon attacks are magical. When the hunter hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra [[/damage 2d8 type=cold]] damage or poison damage (included in the attack), the hunter's choice.
The leviathan hunter has advantage on an attack roll against a target if at least one of the hunter's allies is within 5 feet of the target and the ally isn't &Reference[condition=incapacitated].
While in sunlight, the leviathan hunter has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (&Reference[skill=Perception]) checks that rely on sight.

The leviathan hunter pulls on the cord connected to its harpoon, returning the harpoon to its empty hand. If the harpoon is stuck in a creature, that creature must succeed on a [[/save ability=strength dc=17]] saving throw or be pulled up to 20 feet toward the hunter.

If the leviathan hunter is the target of an attack it can see while grappling a creature, it can hold the &Reference[condition=grappled] creature in the way, and the &Reference[condition=grappled] creature becomes the target of the attack instead.
